page.title: 06Demolition Harris's Calne.
page.content: In 1770,Sarah Harris opened a butcher's shop.Her descendants built up the business, adding bacon curing to their butchery and grocery enterprises.Eventually the shops became a factory. In 1962,it became part of the F.M.C. group.This huge pig meat processing factory dominated Calne for many years,and employed over 1,500 people. In 1982,the Harris factory closed down because it was uneconomical.The demolition firm is pulling the factory down in stages. The huge demolition site is an eyesore in the middle of Calne and residents are looking forward to seeing the plans for a new landscaped development.
